stance_1: Family reasons discourage not eating meat
stance_2: Health reasons discourage not eating meat
justification: Both family and health reasons are cited as barriers to not eating meat, and together support the continued consumption of some meat.

stance_1: Family reasons discourage not eating meat
justification: Family reasons discourage not eating meat, which conflicts with the attempt to eliminate meat.

stance_1: Health reasons discourage not eating meat
justification: Health reasons are given as a barrier, conflicting with the goal to eliminate meat.

stance_1: I avoid eating more intelligent animals
justification: Explicitly stated: avoiding more intelligent animals is the reason for never eating pork.
Eating beef conflicts with the goal of trying to eliminate meat.

stance_1: I eat chicken a few times a week
justification: Eating chicken a few times a week conflicts with the effort to eliminate meat.

stance_1: I share eating habits with my partner
stance_2: My partner agrees meat reduction is morally right
justification: It is explicitly stated that the partner agrees that reducing meat is morally right and that their eating habits are shared.
Supporting animal rights leads to feeling uneasy about eating animals.
Support for animal rights motivates the attempt to eliminate meat.

stance_2: I avoid eating more intelligent animals
justification: Support for animal rights motivates the avoidance of eating more intelligent animals.
Support for animal rights underlies the decision to never eat pork due to pigs' intelligence.

stance_2: I avoid eating more intelligent animals
justification: Avoiding more intelligent animals is part of the imperfect solution to trying to eliminate meat.
